result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew F Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: **Per Order from WI Court of Appeals, DNA surcharge removed**

COMPAS Evaluation and follow through
Defendant to submit DNA sample
No contact with Patz Family
No contact with anyone who uses, sells or possesses illegal drugs
Comply with all DOC rules/pay all supervision fees
Make monthly payments to restitution and court obligations
No Weapons
No contact with any victim family members or their place of employment
No contact with Katie Heller
Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Dept of Corrections
A portion of the defendant's canteen money be garnished for restitution
3/8/17 - Per letter from District Attorney office - there is not any restitution owed in this case

records.addlTxt: Letter to the Court from Defendant, Matthew Moore
Letter to the Court from Defendant, Matthew Moore
Judgment of Conviction- Matthew Moore

IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are modified to remove the DNA surcharges on the homicide convictions; as modified, the judgments are summarily affirmed, and the causes remanded with directions. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Bauer is relieved from further representing Matthew Moore in these matters.
records.descr: Remittitur/Court of Appeals dec & order remanding

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of conviction are modified to remove the DNA surcharges on the homocide convictions; as modified, the judgments are summarily affirmed, and the causes remanded with directions. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Erica Bauer is relieved from further representing Matthew F. Moore in these matters. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will be not published.
